meanings.definition: The act of securing a boat with an anchor.
meanings.sent1: The sailor performed the choring to keep the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent2: The choring of the ship was essential to prevent it from moving in the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: During the storm, the choring of the boat saved it from being swept away.
meanings.sent4: The choring of the vessel was like a steadfast hug keeping it safe in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The choring of the yacht was so tight that not even a strong wind could budge it.

meanings.definition: The act of securing something firmly in place.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used strong nails for the choring of the wooden beams.
meanings.sent2: Proper choring of the tent ensured it stayed put during the windy night.
meanings.sent3: The choring of the painting on the wall made sure it wouldn't fall off.
meanings.sent4: The choring of the statue in the garden gave it a sense of permanence.
meanings.sent5: The choring of the bookshelf kept it steady even when loaded with heavy books.

meanings.definition: The act of providing a secure base or foundation.
meanings.sent1: The strong concrete pillars were the choring of the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The choring of the tree roots kept the soil from eroding during heavy rains.
meanings.sent3: The choring of the bridge ensured its stability during earthquakes.
meanings.sent4: The choring of the platform made it safe for the workers to stand on.
meanings.sent5: The choring of the house's structure made it resilient against strong winds.
